entries.docwu:161: [dismissively] Nightkin prefer to do that. [coldly] I give them chems sometimes. [with bitter resentment] Nobody pays attention to Doctor Wu. They're all assholes! [demandingly] Now, you wanna get fixed up?
entries.docwu:164: [irritably] Idiot! [quickly, under pressure] Cathedral very busy! [stressed] Unity keeps Doctor Wu very busy! [impatiently] Now, you wanna get fixed up?
entries.docwu:165: [with anticipatory glee] Now comes the fun part!
entries.docwu:169: [shouting] Asshole! Shithead! [rapidly] I'm very busy, and you have to bother me! [fiercely] Screw you! [commanding] Get out of here, you puke! [urgently] Now!
entries.docwu:170: [mockingly] You are healthy as a brahmin, but not as bright! [commandingly] Get out of here, you hypochondriac asshole!
entries.docwu:171: [with grudging willingness] You have taken some wounds. [coolly] I can fix that, dickhead, [sternly] if you stay very still!
entries.docwu:174: [with dark humor] Fine. [menacingly] But I hope I perform an autopsy on you by the end of the day!
entries.docwu:179: [with dark amusement] Then leave, asshole! [gleefully] I'll be laughing at your corpse real soon.
entries.docwu:180: [furiously] You little asshole! [with indignant rage] Who do you think you are to bother Dr. Wu? [contemptously] Stupid shithead!
entries.docwu:181: [with grudging willingness] You have taken some wounds. [coolly] I can fix that, dickhead, [sternly] if you stay very still!
entries.docwu:182: [clinically blunt] Five broken bones at least, and you've lost lots of blood. [sardonically] Being an idiot is hazardous to your health! [impatiently] You want to get fixed?
entries.dolgan:115: [with casual approval] Great job on hacking those Rippers. [wryly] What can I do for you?
entries.dolgan:119: [sighing] Sure thing. But it will take most of the day for a little improvement. You still want that?
entries.dolgan:124: [muttering, shaking head] Seems like we let in a fool. [matter-of-factly] Well, if you want to get into their place, there is a slight break in their moat. [deadpan] Look for it and run like mad. You may even make it across.
entries.dragon:112: [with gruff suspicion] What are ya doing roaming around out here?
entries.dragon:116: [gravelly and menacing] Your looking's cost you dearly. What's the story? Tell me the truth, and you may live.
entries.dragon:123: [growling] You found me. Now, [coldly] walk or die!
entries.dragon:126: [leaning in] What's the word on the Rippers?
entries.duc:102: [with a friendly, measured confidence] Well hello, wanderer. My name's Duc, and I'm headed into Shady Sands to do some trading. Perhaps I can interest you in some goods?
entries.duc:106: [with a gesture of openness] Let me show you.
entries.duc:107: [matter-of-factly] Yes, Shady Sands is part of my normal trade route. You can travel there with us for safety if you like.
entries.duc:113: [with genuine curiosity] Not many people brave the wastes alone. Who are you?
entries.duc:118: [warmly, as if greeting an old acquaintance] Hello again! What can I do for you?
entries.duc:122: [straightforwardly, no judgment] What do you want?
entries.dugan:110: [speaking rapidly, trying to sound intellectual] I pontificate on life a lot, and help the Blades understand the true meaning of Nuka-Cola.
entries.dugan:116: [nervously rambling] It is the stuff of life . . . Well actually, if I don't drink it on an hourly basis I get a splitting headache.
entries.dugan:118: [matter-of-factly, a bit defensive] About 5 litres a day.
entries.elder:101: [warmly, with measured authority] I am pleased to meet you. I hope you have found this little village pleasing so far.
entries.elder:104: [with purposeful calm] Excellent. I have a favor to ask of you. I promise that you will be well-rewarded for your services to this community.
entries.elder:106: [with a knowing tone] This is just a demo, but perhaps you will like what I have to say next.
entries.elder:108: [gravely, settling into the weight of it] We have been plagued by Rad Scorpions for some time now. All who have been sent to destroy these monsters have not returned. I will give you weapons and armor if you will follow my guide to their lair and kill them all.
entries.elder:111: [with cold disappointment] That is a shame. Please leave.
entries.elder:112: [with fatherly encouragement] Excellent. Sammy here will guide you to the lair. Take these items - they will come in useful.
entries.falcon1:101: [with weary dismissal] Yeah, whadda ya want?
entries.farli:103: [with military precision] Katja chu nee ka Chak'ra Farli.
entries.fgtcarvn:103: [straightforward, matter-of-fact] So you signed up. Good to hear it. So ya know, we leave just about every ten days. That's the 8th, 18th, and 28th of each month. Right now we're making runs to The Brotherhood, Junktown and the LA Boneyard.
entries.fgtcarvn:112: [with reluctant acceptance] I'll still give you a job, even though... never mind. Are you interested?
entries.fgtcarvn:125: [frustrated, exasperated] Couldn't just leave my stuff alone, could you? Why did you do it?
entries.fgtcarvn:145: [briskly, all business] Well OK then! It'll pay 400 hubbucks. Which route would you prefer?
entries.fgtcarvn:185: [with genuine approval] You did a good piece of work. You want to sign up for another?
entries.fgtcarvn:191: [impatiently] Got all your gear? We're going out today.
entries.fishrman:103: [with a friendly drawl] Howdy sir. I don't often see strangers in this spot. Is there something I can do for you?
entries.fishrman:104: [with a friendly drawl] Howdy ma'am. I don't often see strangers in this spot. Is there something I can do for you?
entries.fishrman:111: [excitedly] Wait a minute, aren't you that fella who wanders the wastes and kicks the monsters' butts? Can I help you?
entries.fishrman:112: [excitedly] What a minute, aren't you that filly who wanders the wastes and kicks the monsters' butts? Can I help you?
entries.fishrman:114: [rambling, a bit exasperated] No man's ever called me inhospitable, and I don't want to repeat what women call me, but I am trying to fish and I need absolute quiet to catch the damn things, so please try to keep quiet.
entries.fishrman:118: [chuckling, matter-of-factly] Do I look like a scavenger to you? Well, maybe I do, but that's because I spend a lot of time in the Wastes trying to teach my boy to fish and be a man.
entries.fishrman:119: [gravelly, with a note of concern] I haven't done any scavenging in six years. Too many Rad Scorpions. A fella could get killed out there with all them varmints running around.
entries.fishrman:120: [drawling casually] About eight years ago, I sold some chips in Junktown. I don't know what they did. One of them could have been a water chip, though I wouldn't bet on it.
entries.fishrman:122: [with dry humor] Mutant armies? Not in this spot. Just regular armies would be bad enough, heh heh.
entries.fishrman:123: [rambling earnestly] You know there's too much politics in the world. I keep telling my boy that these politicians can't wait to blow up the world again. That's why I'm living off the land, to avoid the politicians! Only way to live.
entries.fishrman:124: [with gruff sincerity] Now that's rather personal information there. I've killed men for asking less, just ask the boy. But I think you look like an honest person, so I'll let it slide this time.
entries.fishrman:125: [sighing with frustration] Well, I've fished this place for the last five years and it keeps getting worse and worse. I think it's Skunk, the three-eyed giant catfish, that keeps scaring everything away from my spot.
entries.fishrman:126: [with determined intensity] But I'm gonna get that fish, just you wait. It's getting personal between us, and only one of us is gonna walk away, believe me. I'm more serious than the Brotherhood of Steel about this.
entries.fishrman:127: [reluctantly, with weary resignation] Now you'll probably kill me, but if I don't stand up to you, I'll be setting a bad example for the boy. See my dilemma? Why don't you just walk away and make it easier for both of us!
entries.fishrman:135: [helpfully] Well, I heard about a big Vault way to the East, and reports of a secret Vault somewhere down south. And there may be some chips in Junktown and the Hub. Hope that helps.
entries.fishrman:137: [shaking head gravely] Mutant armies? Just plain armies would be bad enough. I heard tell that someone's been harassing the ghouls over in Necropolis, but that was a while ago.
entries.fishrman:138: [with self-deprecating humor] Now that's a personal question. My mother's womb, of course, but that's a little too flip. I don't have a home no more. Me and my boy just wander and try to survive.
entries.fishrman:139: [evasively] I do know where some caches are stored, but that's my secret.
entries.fishrman:140: [matter-of-factly] Well, it's kill or be killed - the Law of the Wastes - out here, but I'll tell you what. You keep killing monsters and I'll give you some supplies.
entries.fishrman:141: [with bemused bewilderment] Yeah you are. But what the hell does 'runk' mean? Whatever it is, I hope it's friendly.
entries.fishrman:142: [indignantly, rambling] Now I'm hurt. Here I go, out of my way to be neighborly, and you accuse me of rambling! Well! I don't offend easy, but you just gone and made me mad enough to nuke someone.
entries.fishrman:145: [casually curious] What do you want to talk about?
entries.fishrman:152: [dismissively, with a tired wave] Fine. Take what you want and get out.
entries.fishrson:109: [excitedly, speaking quickly] Hi. Aren't you that person who goes around helping people? You must got lots of interesting stories to tell!
entries.fishrson:111: [with a slight grin] Hi there. I see you're not stupid enough to be fishing here. What's up?
entries.fishrson:112: [hesitantly, voice cracking] Not sure. Dad and I have been wandering the wastes for so long. We had a friend, a scorpion hunter with us, but he went nuts and we had to kill him, and then we . . .
entries.fishrson:113: [nervously, trailing off] Hmmm, maybe I shouldn't talk about that.
entries.fishrson:116: [defensively, mimicking] It sucks. Sorry, I shouldn't use the word 'suck.' Dad thinks that people who say suck all the time are either brain-dead simpletons or inarticulate losers. Dad's always trying to sound smart.
entries.fishrson:119: [earnestly, with a slight wheeze] I saw a big thing like a giant spider with two heads, and one head looked human. Dad thinks I sucked up too much radiation. I dunno. Contaminated water does weird stuff to the brain.
entries.fishrson:126: [breathlessly excited, speeding up] Yeah. Did you ever hear about the raiders who fell into the Rad Scorpion nest and they all got stung and stung and eaten alive, except for the one who ran away with half his face chewed off!
entries.fishrson:128: [shrugging, matter-of-factly] Well he's kind of loud and boring, and I ain't sure he's my real dad. I think he musta stole me when I was a baby. But he feeds me most of the time, so I like him, I guess.
entries.fishrson:129: [seriously, with concern] They're big and they're nasty, and they're getting outta control. Dad said there used to be heroes who'd wander around the wastes and kill them off, but most of them are dead now, I guess.
entries.fishrson:132: [urgently] Big Henry used to go with us, and he was better'n dad and me, until he went insane and tried to strangle me. Dad had to shoot him!
entries.fishrson:136: [with determination, young voice full of admiration] A lot of heroes. The guy who founded the Brotherhood of Steel, Roger Maxim, he was a real good scorpion killer. When I get older, I'm gonna find out where they are and join them!
entries.fishrson:139: [grudgingly impressed] He's okay, I guess. Actually, I saw him hit a Rad Scorpion between the eyes at seventy yards, but it was a fluke shot.
entries.billy:101: [cheerfully, with a nervous edge] Hi there.
entries.billy:107: [talking quickly, anxiously] Why would you want a brahmin? Do you have a caravan? Well, it doesn't matter. I only take care of them. Dan is the one that owns them; he won't sell them though.
entries.billy:112: [fidgeting, nervously] Nothing . . . I mean, I'm taking care of the brahmin.
entries.billy:115: [earnestly, speaking rapidly] What's a brahmin? You must be joking. Why they're one of the major food sources and forms of transportation around here. They haul the caravans. Dan says this is a really important job, but it's the Bone.
entries.billy:121: [with friendly caution] You're not from around here, are you? [more seriously, whispering] I'll give you one tip: Don't get caught stealing!
entries.billy:132: [reassuringly, with a hint of amusement] Dangerous? No, not really. They can give you a really nasty bite, but they're pretty cool. [laughing slightly] They fart and burp a lot. I don't know why.
entries.billy:136: [pleadingly, voice trembling with worry] Please don't talk to me. Dan is going to yell at me again. [voice cracking] He really gets pissed - I mean - mad, when I'm not paying attention to what I'm doing.
entries.billy:143: [defensively, almost shouting] I AM working hard!
entries.billy:154: [whimpering, fearfully] Please don't talk to me, Dan is really mad.
entries.flash:113: [menacingly] No way. The Doc is sleeping. Come back later.
entries.flash:116: [aggressively] Hey, this is private property. You'd better be leaving, now.
entries.flash:119: [scoffing] Don't you know that women are the weaker sex?
entries.flash:122: [laughing mockingly] Take your puny threats and run home to mamma. You're talking to a real man here.
entries.flip:104: [with a deep, menacing growl] So, a human. This is very interesting. You will come with me to the Lieutenant, or you will perish right here.
entries.flip:108: [barking gruffly] Excellent. Come with me if you want to live.
entries.francis:105: [with serene breathy calm] Hi. I'm meditating. Did you notice? Can I help you?
entries.francis:113: [with gentle, meditative warmth] Hello, brother. Can I help you?
entries.francis:114: [with gentle, meditative warmth] Hello, sister. Can I help you?
entries.francis:160: [with eerie placidity] Hello, sir. Can I help you?
entries.francis:161: [with eerie placidity] Hello, miss. Can I help you?
entries.fry:101: [sternly, with menacing authority] I've been hoping to run into you, child killer. I hope your stay isn't long. [coldly] I'll be playing close attention to you while you're here. Keep your nose clean in my city, [threateningly] I'm just dying for an excuse to get rid of scum like you.
entries.fry:102: [cheerfully, with eager helpfulness] Hello friend, Deputy Tony Fry at your service.
entries.fry:107: [excitedly] Oh, a newcomer! Welcome to the Hub! [proudly] You've reached the biggest city on the coast. [with uncertain enthusiasm] Heck, maybe the biggest city in the world for all we know. [curiously, with slight nervousness] I thought you were part of the caravan, did you come in with them?
entries.fry:110: [calmly] I'm not surprised. Most of the new members of our city come in with the caravans, even with the missing caravans we've had. It's a fine city [shifting to stern caution] but be careful who you associate with. [seriously] People like Decker and his thugs can get you into a lot of trouble.
entries.fry:111: [thoughtfully] That's surprising. [with concern] It's been pretty rough out there, especially with the missing caravans. [reassuringly] But you're safe now, [firmly] just stay away from the Maltese Falcon. [with intensity] They're a bunch of trouble makers, Decker and his crew.
entries.fry:117: [with resigned patience] If you say so. [eagerly] So, did you have any other questions?
entries.fry:118: [sadly] It's a tragedy really. [with concern] Some caravans have turned up missing. [helpfully] Butch over at the Far Go Traders is offering a reward for information or something. [encouragingly] You should check at the merchant market if you're interested.
entries.fry:119: [matter-of-factly] He owns the Maltese Falcon in the merchant market, [warningly] but I wouldn't associate with him if you want to stay out of trouble. [with controlled anger] He's nothing but a murdering animal, [frustratedly] but the Sheriff won't let me arrest him without proof.
entries.fry:125: [accusingly, with sharp anger] There you are, you thieving little snake! [shocked] I almost didn't recognize you. [shouting commandingly] Guards!
entries.fry:130: [warmly, with genuine friendliness] Hello again. I hope you like our town. A nice young man such as yourself, is always welcome. [eagerly] If you should decide to stay, I'm sure you would make a valuable addition to the Hub.
entries.fry:131: [warmly, with genuine friendliness] Hello again. I hope you like our town. A lovely lady such as yourself, is always welcome. [eagerly] If you should decide to stay, I'm sure you would make a valuable addition to the Hub.
entries.fry:132: [casually friendly] Hello again. [helpfully] What can I do for you?
entries.fry:133: [slightly impatient, with nervous edge] Yes? I don't have all day. I'm trying to watch the front gate.
entries.fry:141: [hesitantly, with nervous stammering] Really? I, uh, you should talk to the Sheriff. [anxiously] I can't leave my post right now. I've got to . . . uh, [stuttering] fend off any raiders that might come. [self-consciously] Plus, I'm not very good with reports.
entries.fry:142: [apologetically] Oh, sorry. I hadn't noticed. [helpfully] The Children run the Hospital next to the Water Merchants. [clear and informative] Go south past the Merchant market and you'll see it just northwest of the Water Merchants. [warmly] I hope everything goes okay.
entries.fry:143: [confidently enthusiastic] That's hard to miss. [proudly] It's by far the busiest part of town. The Merchant Market is a few miles south of here. [informatively] You'll be most interested in the northern section, that's where most of our locals buy and sell to the public.
entries.fry:144: [helpfully] Why that would be in the Merchant Market, a few miles south of here. Two of the caravan houses are located there, the third is further south. [encouragingly] I'd recommend the Far Go Traders. They pay well and they're not too crazy.
entries.fry:148: [uncertainly] Water Chip? [thoughtfully] Well, I've never heard of one. [helpfully] If it has to do with water, though, you should talk to the Water Merchants. [informatively] Their headquarters are located further south, past the Downtown area.
entries.gabriel:102: [warmly, if cautiously] It's not often that we get visitors, how can I help you?
entries.gabriel:105: [gravelly, frustrated] This place isn't very accessible with a nest of those damn Deathclaws right outside our factory.
entries.gabriel:107: [with weary practicality] We've gone over there and taken out a few, but they always seem to come back. Besides, we're machinists, not fighters.
entries.gabriel:109: [heavily] We manufacture weapons and ammunition. [pause] We've been at this for the last 30 years. But the last 10 have been hell.
entries.gabriel:111: [gruffly] We've stripped the area surrounding our factory of all the scrap metals that were left after the war. [slowly] Now we have to rely on Adytum to supply us with raw materials.
entries.gabriel:113: [darkly, with controlled anger] At first it was fine. They supplied us with raw materials, we manufactured and sold the weapons. Then 3 years ago Zimmerman hired some mercenaries to help protect Adytum from the deathclaw and the odd random attack by raiders. Those Regulators are cold hearted bastards and are squeezing us for all we have. We make the guns and they get rich off of it.
entries.gabriel:116: [resignedly] We would if we could. But moving is a major undertaking with all the lathes and mills. These are things that aren't just picked up easily moved. [firmly] We could move but the deathclaw make it impossible.
entries.gabriel:118: [with sudden intensity] If you could get rid of the Deathclaws once and for all you could name your price.
entries.gabriel:121: [with grim determination] If you clean out that area we'll be leaving, but we'll leave behind more weapons and ammunition than you could possibly use.
entries.gabriel:125: [nodding gravelly] You clear out the Deathclaws, all of them, and you got yourself a deal.
entries.gabriel:134: [cautiously, measured] We need to be sure. We've killed over 20 in the past 2 years and they always seem to come back. And we could never figure out how. [pause] Let's give it a few days and if they are still gone we'll see what we can do for ya'.
entries.gabriel:136: [simply] Let us know when you've taken care of the Deathclaws.
entries.gabriel:138: [with a heavy sigh] I know, tell me about it.
entries.gabriel:140: [warmly, if cautiously] It's not often that we get visitors, can I help you?
entries.gabriel:143: [gravelly, frustrated] This place isn't very accessible, with a nest of those damn Deathclaw right outside our factory.
entries.gabriel:145: [resignedly] We would if we could. But moving is a major under taking with all the lathes and mills. These are things that aren't just picked up and easily moved. [firmly] We could move but the Deathclaw make it impossible.
entries.gabriel:151: [with relieved practicality] You got it- just take whatever you want. We're pulling out of here in a day or two, but we'll leave more weapons and ammo than you could carry right now. [pause] Just come back here whenever you need them.
entries.gabriel:174: [with shocked relief, then growing excitement] You what?! You've killed them all? [with genuine gratitude] Thank the gods! Now we can move to where we can get our own materials and not have to rely on those snakes in Adytum. [with open generosity] You name it and you've got it, my friend.
entries.gabriel:175: [with shocked relief, then growing excitement] You what?! You've killed them all? [with genuine gratitude] Thank the gods! Now we can move to where we can get our own materials and not have to rely on those snakes in Adytum. [with open generosity] You name it and you've got it, my friend.
entries.gabriel:178: [firmly] You got it. Let your friends know that they got their weapons.
entries.gabriel:179: [firmly] You got it. Let your friends know that they got their weapons.
entries.gabriel:180: [warmly, with genuine gratitude] Thank you my friend.
entries.gabriel:181: [warmly, with genuine gratitude] Thank you my friend.
entries.gabriel:184: [with satisfied finality] There's no reason to leave now that your friends have gotten rid of those damn regulators.
entries.gabriel:185: [with satisfied finality] There's no reason to leave now that your friends have gotten rid of those damn regulators.
entries.gabriel:186: [warmly] Welcome, friend. What can I help you with?
entries.gabriel:187: [warmly] Welcome, friend. What can I help you with?
entries.gambler:102: [with smooth charm] Oye, muchacho, allow me to introduce myself. I am Hernandez, a man of mucho gusto! You look like you are new here. Please, allow me to be your informant to the casino.
entries.gambler:112: [confidently] Perhaps you can spare a few caps? I guarantee success.
entries.gambler:119: [warmly persuasive] My friend, I see you are a man of much taste, as well. Perhaps a simple game of dice?
entries.gambler:123: [matter-of-factly] He gives people a chance to shrug off their cares in the broken world outside. And he brings money into Junktown!
entries.gambler:127: [casually, with a knowing smile] Well, Gizmo runs a pretty good house, although the games are, how shall we say, rather weighted towards the house. It's not like his dealers cheat, though. But unless you have a system, like me, you will need to be very clever.
entries.gambler:136: [with oily charm] Buenos dias, my friend! What can I do for you today?
entries.gambler:137: [with oily charm] Buenos dias, my friend! What can I do for you today?
entries.ganger:101: [raspy, menacing] What are you doing here? Answer wisely - this could be your only chance . . .
entries.ganger:106: [with brutish slowness] Set ain't here, so git.
entries.ganger:110: [in a gravelly growl] You gots some mental problems to work out. Set's not gonna let some loser like you take 'em down. He's got the guards and he's got the guns.
entries.ganger:113: [slowly, matter-of-factly] Set keeps at least two guards around him at all times, but he can call on more then ten if he needs it. And when he's in his throne room, those ten guards are seconds away.
entries.ganger:116: [gravelly, firmly] I'm supposed to make sure no one goes by. Dis is Zombie house.
entries.ganger:119: [with ponderous emphasis] Not a what . . . A WHO. We are the Zombies. If we do good, Set'll make us one of his guards. Now that's all I'm gonna tell you.
entries.ganger:123: [raspy, dismissively] You crazy. What do you think dis is? You better leave.
entries.ganger:126: [menacingly] I don't think so. Get out before I call the boyz over and dance on your face.
entries.ganger:129: [growling, with brutal certainty] It was. Now it's a fact. ZOMBIES!
entries.garret:101: [with raspy gravel voice] You shouldn't be here during the day. It makes Set unhappy. [growling] Come back at night
entries.garret:109: [gravelly and stern] You had better leave now.
entries.genchant:102: [with bouncy enthusiasm, singing] Hello friend! Will you sing a song of Praise with me? [melodiously] . . . Once I was wandering blind, In a land that was so unkind . . .
entries.genchant:108: [excitedly, with unsettling cheer] He finds you when and where you least expect it! [with fervent intensity] Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame! Praise the world!
entries.genchant:109: [laughing with forced brightness] What a wonderful joke! [with creepy satisfaction] I used to have no sense of humor, but thanks to the Master, I am full of mirth! [cheerfully] Praise the Master!
entries.genchant:110: [in a reverent, bouncy singsong] The one who sits above. The one who sits below. The one who rests within. [with blissful certainty] Praise the Master for such clarity of vision!
entries.genchant:111: [wistfully, with unsettling eagerness] Oh, if only I were so fortunate! [dreamily] Perhaps one day the Master will let me kiss his body parts. [with euphoric devotion] Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
entries.genchant:112: [with saccharine sweetness, correcting] Hmm, that's not what I had in mind. [in a perky, patronizing tone] You had better practice, my friend. [with bouncy fervor] Praise to the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
entries.genmutan:104: [with stern, gravelly authority] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
entries.genmutan:105: [with stern, gravelly authority] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
entries.genmutan:115: [in a low, rumbling tone] Yes, little brother. What is it that you need from me?
entries.genmutan:116: [in a low, rumbling tone] Yes, little sister. What is it that you need from me?
entries.genmutan:122: [condescendingly, with a growling sigh] He resides on Level 3, as he must. Why do you ask such a silly question?
entries.genmutan:128: [with suspicion, voice dropping lower] You sound like you do not believe what you say. Could this be true? Or have you left the path of righteousness?
entries.genmutan:132: [dismissively, with gruff impatience] What do you want this time? I have little time for your talk.
entries.genpalb:102: [barking sharply] Hold, initiate! What do you have to report?
entries.genpalb:108: [suspiciously] Hold! I recognize you -- you've visited the Brotherhood. Some may trust you, but I do not. [commandingly] State your business!
entries.genpalb:116: [barking a challenge] Hold! Who goes there! [sharply] State your name and your business!
entries.genpalb:128: [with urgent intensity] These are troubled times, Initiate! [barking] Mutants are on the march, attacking caravans! [demanding] We need information, and we need it now! [threateningly] Nothing to report is not good enough!
entries.genpalb:131: [coldly accusatory] This is our land, and here, your business is our business. [commanding] I repeat, state your business.
entries.genpalb:143: [grimly] We found a wrecked caravan about a day's journey to the west. We found one survivor - poor girl. [heavily] She claimed they were attacked by mutant humans with incredible strength.
entries.genraid2:125: [defensively] Nah. I ain't seen her. Why are you asking?
entries.genraid2:130: [hesitantly] Really? What does she look like?
entries.gensarg:107: [with authoritative gravel] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
entries.gensarg:108: [with authoritative gravel] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
entries.gensarg:114: [growling, demanding] Show me your pass, then.
entries.gensarg:118: [with patient rumble] Yes, little brother. What is it that you need from me?
entries.gensarg:119: [with patient rumble] Yes, little sister. What is it that you need from me?
entries.gensarg:125: [slowly, as if stating obvious truth] Here is here. Why do you ask?
entries.gensarg:131: [with stern, philosophical weight] You sound like you do not believe what you say. Could this be true? Or have you left the path of righteous?
entries.gensarg:135: [with weary impatience, gravel-deep] What do you want this time? I have little time for your talk.
entries.gensupr:115: [with gravelly authority] Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.
entries.ghdorgrd:101: [with a raspy growl] Go away! You're not wanted here.
entries.ghdorgrd:105: [barking gruffly] The door is locked. You'll have to come back later when it's dark.
entries.ghdorgrd:108: [menacingly rasping] I told you to leave. Your kind is not wanted here.
entries.ghdorgrd:111: [gravelly and impatient] The doors don't open until dark.
entries.ghguard:102: [with raspy wariness] You shouldn't be here . . .
entries.ghguard:106: [in a gravelly, measured tone] That doesn't sound right. You'd better come along with me.
entries.ghguard:109: [with professional concern, voice grinding] I don't think you want to go to that room.
entries.ghguard:113: [slowly, each word grating like stone] We are here to make sure that people that don't belong in Set's room don't go into it. Not for Set's safety, actually, but for theirs. Anything else?
entries.ghoul:101: [with a raspy bark] Whatta you doing here?
entries.ghoul:112: [snarling through gravel-scraped throat] Donna be in my face likka dat. I runna dis show.
entries.gideon:101: [intensely, voice trailing] Jason is a living god! Only the nullified may pass!
entries.gideon:107: [spacily, confused] The walls also have minds . . . I saw you . . . tomorrow?
entries.gideon:116: [reverently, drifting] Yes, the walls are alive with those that have gone before.
entries.gideon:119: [dreamily, fragmented] Meeting of the soul . . . melded with, to protect, the Master of all.
entries.gideon:125: [whispering, voice trailing off] There is only peace and joining . . . the price . . . the pain . . . one must be blind . . . nulled.
entries.gideon:130: [softly, wobbling] I will anoint you . . . I must give what I must not.
entries.gideon:135: [manically, laughing] You cannot kill the genius of . . . the all . . . you . . . hehf!
entries.gideon:145: [ominously spaced-out, trailing] Those who have gone before . . . must stop your journey.
